titles.title: Atomic Test Veterans Recognition Act

To direct the Secretary of Defense to present a ribbon of appropriate design to all persons who, while a member of the Armed Forces serving on active duty, were exposed to ionizing radiation as a result of participation in a test of atomic weapons.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 3/20/2003--Introduced. Atomic Test Veterans Recognition Act - Directs the Secretary of Defense to design and issue an Atomic Testing Recognition Ribbon to honor each veteran who was exposed to ionizing radiation as a result of atomic weapons tests conducted by the United States between 1945 and 1963.
